channel.title: League of Legends RPG
channel.description:
Sup mopar. Wanted to show off a new project I started.
So first off a description of the game. The game is going to be an RPG (not mmo), where you play as your favorite champ from league of legends. You will actually be able to experience their lore instead of reading about it. There will be a levelling system and it will be pretty linear (not open world or anything). But I will add a lot of cool aspects into the game. By the way I will be using unreal engine 4.
Here's a few pics:
In-game: [IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/30kx6pw.png[/img]
In-game: [IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/qx8lcl.png[/img]
Wire-Frame: [IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/bcsph.png[/img]
Rig: [IMG]http://i58.tinypic.com/6r3hxl.png[/img]
What do you guys think? Ideas? Tips? Champion Requests? (Because I don't really plan on animating and coding ALL of them)!

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:12, topic:553032”]It’s confusing but I doubt that applies to in game assets, at least when ripped like that. Page you linked says that the terms of service overrule it, and the terms of service says:

[quote]
You agree that you will not, under any circumstances:

B. Copy, photocopy, reproduce, translate, reverse engineer, decompile, derive source code from, or disassemble, in whole or in part, the Software or the Game, or create derivative works based on the Game, except that you are authorized to (i) make one (1) copy of the Software and the Documentation for personal archival purposes only; and (ii) use third party image and video capture software to capture the output of the Software as audio, video and/or still image files solely for personal, not for profit use pursuant to the Terms of Use and any applicable Riot Games policies pertaining to audio or video creation[/quote]

I think the bit you linked is mostly referring to creating derivative artwork, games with completely new assets etc. but using their characters/lore[/quote]

Yes I’ve read this from what I understand is that they do not want me to copy league code/functionality. As for models I did get the vertices from the client to morph my mesh, but Maya (An 3rd party software by autodesk), did all the work. Not sure if that counts as an exception.

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:12, topic:553032”]It’s confusing but I doubt that applies to in game assets, at least when ripped like that. Page you linked says that the terms of service overrule it, and the terms of service says:

[quote]
You agree that you will not, under any circumstances:

B. Copy, photocopy, reproduce, translate, reverse engineer, decompile, derive source code from, or disassemble, in whole or in part, the Software or the Game, or create derivative works based on the Game, except that you are authorized to (i) make one (1) copy of the Software and the Documentation for personal archival purposes only; and (ii) use third party image and video capture software to capture the output of the Software as audio, video and/or still image files solely for personal, not for profit use pursuant to the Terms of Use and any applicable Riot Games policies pertaining to audio or video creation[/quote]

I think you are correct. Most of the time Riot doesnt care if you use their trademarks, unless its for profit without their permission.
I think the bit you linked is mostly referring to creating derivative artwork, games with completely new assets etc. but using their characters/lore[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

At this point Riot would probably pay him for developing something to do with the lore lol

But for real, unless the project gets big I am sure it will be undercover for quite some time. If this is just a hobby project then don’t even worry about it.

Good luck on this, definitely a fresh idea.

Read full topic

item.description:

It’s confusing but I doubt that applies to in game assets, at least when ripped like that. Page you linked says that the terms of service overrule it, and the terms of service says:

You agree that you will not, under any circumstances:

B. Copy, photocopy, reproduce, translate, reverse engineer, decompile, derive source code from, or disassemble, in whole or in part, the Software or the Game, or create derivative works based on the Game, except that you are authorized to (i) make one (1) copy of the Software and the Documentation for personal archival purposes only; and (ii) use third party image and video capture software to capture the output of the Software as audio, video and/or still image files solely for personal, not for profit use pursuant to the Terms of Use and any applicable Riot Games policies pertaining to audio or video creation

I think the bit you linked is mostly referring to creating derivative artwork, games with completely new assets etc. but using their characters/lore

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Pwnd:

Good luck with this. You have quite a lot of work ahead of you, especially if you’re working alone. You also have to worry about copyright infringement. Hell, you might as well just come up with your own game, unless Riot Games decides to pick up your project.

Actually all media is usable except for logos. (Only certain textures for model skins have logos embedded in them).

You can find this rule here: http://www.riotgames.com/legal-jibber-jabber

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Good luck with this. You have quite a lot of work ahead of you, especially if you’re working alone. You also have to worry about copyright infringement. Hell, you might as well just come up with your own game, unless Riot Games decides to pick up your project.

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

their way of dealing with it sucks tbh.
you get 5 lines of intro to a champ and some of them interact with one another in the game. that’s it. that’s lore in league of legends.

how am i ever supposed to know details about champs like how wild does jinx get when she puts her zap! in her pussy?

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

does the gave even bother with lore anymore? I thought they started phasing that out.

A lot of complaints have surfaced from players due to the lack of quality lore. I don’t pay much attention to lore, but the Bilgewater event that Riot just finished up with was created mainly due to this reason. The lore is not being phased out, it just became really sucky and now Riot is trying to overhaul it from what I’ve read.

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Mopman:

wait wut, they’re removing summoners from a game about summoners?

yes right on the money

Read full topic

item.description:

wait wut, they’re removing summoners from a game about summoners?

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Yes they actually Hired a new writer a couple months back. The reason for it being so shotty now is that they are removing the League from the lore. So no more summoners and stuff like that. They are basically rewriting it. Which in my own opinion will definitely have continuity issues because in-game champs like nidalee, lux, udyr, all talk to the summoner. I don’t think there is an actual release date for the new lore though.

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

does the gave even bother with lore anymore? I thought they started phasing that out.

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

well I started just a few days ago. I’m not sure if you missed the part where I said you play through the lore. Also I have to animate it myself (which takes time or else I break Anivia’s neck). If I don’t animate it, it would just be a block of mesh with a hitbox.
So after I am done animating her the way I want and making sure particles match up with the mesh. Then I will start the level design. Which will be based off Frejlord (For Anivia’s story atleast). Fighting of the Corruption that is Sejuani and Lissandra. (I have very fun ideas for said… “Boss Battles”).

Read full topic

item.title: League of Legends RPG
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

All I’m seeing is a model that looks like it was ripped from the game loaded into UE. Do you have any actual game screenshots or game info besides “its gunna be a league rpg?”
